intro: Psychotria olgae, commonly known as the Olgae Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that are typically dark red when mature. Psychotria olgae is often found growing in shaded understory environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
